intro: Cecropia rugosa, commonly known as the rough-leaved cecropia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its large, rough-textured leaves and distinctive yellow-orange flowers. It is often found in lowland rainforests and can grow up to several meters in height. Cecropia rugosa plays an important role in its ecosystem, providing shelter and food for various insects and birds.
